case_information.application_type: Spouse or Common-Law Partner in Canada Class

sponsor.name: Wang Xiaoshuai (王晓帅)
sponsor.address: No 2 Main St, Burnaby, BC, V2X 0Y2

case_law.case_name: Yu v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2016 FC 540
case_law.key_points: IAD/签证官可基于矛盾与不合理之处认定非真实；真实性属事实判断，法院以合理性审查为主
case_law.relevance: 短时间关系并非自动失败，但口供矛盾、解释不可信会直接导致 IRPR 4(1) 风险

case_law.case_name: Kalsi v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2016 FC 442
case_law.key_points: IAD 以可信度与证据权衡认定 IRPR 4(1) 不满足
case_law.relevance: 需要把“同住/共同生活/共同财务/社交认可”的证据链做成可核验、可交叉印证

case_law.case_name: Parmar v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2018 FC 323
case_law.key_points: 官员可列举多项“坏信”指示因素；IAD认为证词增加疑点、可信度不足而维持拒签
case_law.relevance: 关系从房东-租客发展，需解释转折点与动机，避免“为身份”推定

case_law.case_name: Lai v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2015 FC 370
case_law.key_points: 事实明确提到“通过房东认识配偶”；官员关注同住证据薄弱、租金来源、面谈矛盾与“迎合式改口”
case_law.relevance: 与本案高度相似（房东-租客起点）。需要把“租住→恋爱→结婚”的证据按时间线固化

case_law.case_name: Zhou v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2020 FC 633
case_law.key_points: 线上认识约6个月后结婚；官员/IAD以 IRPR 4(1) 拒绝并在JR中被讨论
case_law.relevance: 短时间线在判例中常被当作“需要更强证据解释”的风险因子

case_law.case_name: Benjamin v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2025 FC 1421
case_law.key_points: 明确为 SCLPC；官员以 IRPR 4(1)(a) 与 IRPR 第124条等要求拒绝
case_law.relevance: 直接对应“访客身份境内递交 + 真实性”。用于说明审查框架与常见拒因结构

case_law.case_name: Ihejieto v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2007 FC 1154
case_law.key_points: 申请人结婚后递交 SCLPC；另就访客身份恢复作出JR
case_law.relevance: 可用于说明“境内递交”与“身份问题并行存在”的典型事实结构

case_law.case_name: Miah v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2015 FC 36
case_law.key_points: 讨论 IRPR 125(1)(c)：赞助人需证明未仍与前配偶处于婚姻关系；并涉及前婚姻披露不完整
case_law.relevance: 用于“前婚姻/离婚证明/披露完整性”的核心框架

case_law.case_name: Coube De Carvalho v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2019 FC 1485
case_law.key_points: 因婚姻状况不实触发 IRPA s.40(1)(a)；GCMS 作为理由组成部分被引用
case_law.relevance: 若任何表格/签证/工签历史中婚姻状况与本次叙述不一致，属于高风险点

case_law.case_name: Canada (Citizenship and Immigration) v. Ogunseitan, 2020 FC 194
case_law.key_points: 申请人曾称“未婚/无子女”，后发现长期合法婚姻；IAD增加 s.40 争点；同时出现“配偶子女合法收养/子女法律身份”担忧
case_law.relevance: 同时覆盖“前婚姻披露”与“继子女/子女法律身份（监护/收养/亲权）”的审查视角

case_law.case_name: Saporsantos Leobrera v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2010 FC 587
case_law.key_points: 判决中直接引出 IRPR 第2条对“dependent child”的定义
case_law.relevance: 用于锚定“受抚养子女”的法规定义来源

case_law.case_name: Ling Du v. Canada (Citizenship and Immigration), 2012 FC 1094
case_law.key_points: 涉及离婚后子女居住/监护、再婚与后续担保子女；并触发 IRPR 117(9)(d) “未申报/未审查家庭成员”体系
case_law.relevance: 用于提醒：任何过往移民/签证申请中对子女/家庭成员披露不一致，会引出更严重的资格排除

policy_sections.title: Who qualifies as a dependent child?
policy_sections.relevance: 用于对照“dependent child”资格要件准备证明材料

policy_sections.title: Establishing identity and relationship
policy_sections.relevance: 把“同住地址、租约、共同生活事实”做成可核验的客观证据链

policy_sections.title: Relationships of convenience
policy_sections.relevance: 逐项反证“关系便利性/为移民目的”的指示因素

policy_sections.title: Conjugal relationships – Dissolutions of convenience
policy_sections.relevance: 用于分析关系解除的真实性

policy_sections.title: Characteristics of conjugal relationships
policy_sections.relevance: 用其“conjugal relationship”特征/评估框架组织证据目录

policy_sections.title: Assessment of conjugal relationships
policy_sections.relevance: 用其“conjugal relationship”特征/评估框架组织证据目录

policy_sections.title: Marriage in Canada
policy_sections.relevance: 用于分析在加拿大境内结婚的合法性

policy_sections.title: Legality of foreign divorces
policy_sections.relevance: 准备离婚/婚姻解除文件的合法性与可承认性材料

policy_sections.title: What happens if common-law partner (principal applicant) is married to another person?
policy_sections.relevance: 如果任何一方在关系形成期间仍处婚姻关系或存在未解除婚姻，需要先解决资格障碍

policy_sections.title: Procedure: Identifying a relationship of convenience
policy_sections.relevance: 用于识别便利婚姻的程序

policy_sections.title: Marriage of convenience
policy_sections.relevance: 用于分析便利婚姻的特征

policy_sections.title: Common-law partnership of convenience
policy_sections.relevance: 用于分析便利同居关系的特征

policy_sections.title: Conjugal partner relationship of convenience
policy_sections.relevance: 用于分析便利伴侣关系的特征

strengths: Long-term fixed residence (owned property) can serve as anchor for cohabitation and shared life
Both parties have terminated previous marriages
If divorce documents are complete and timeline is clear, can reduce doubts about 'bigamy/unclear status'
Application submission timing (about 3 months after marriage) follows common operational rhythm
weaknesses: Relationship development is short and started from landlord-tenant relationship, naturally triggering convenience marriage review
Child information contradiction belongs to 'verifiable error', will be seen as a signal of overall material quality and authenticity
Shared finances, shared responsibility division, shared social recognition currently do not show strong evidence
Any inconsistency in historical application information will upgrade risk from 'IRPR 4(1)' to 'IRPA s.40'
opportunities: Through 'timeline + third-party records + shared finances/responsibilities + social recognition' four evidence chains parallel reinforcement, can pull the case from 'interview-type high volatility' back to 'document-type passable'
Proactive correction + verifiable documents for child information contradiction can turn it from threat to 'integrity and material governance capability' bonus point
threats: Interview中出现迎合式改口、关键细节前后不一，会直接落入案例法中的常见败因路径
If historical record inconsistencies are discovered, may trigger misrepresentation, causing long-term adverse consequences

risk_factors.description: '12 years old' vs '2020-01-03 birth date' inconsistency
Applicant's visitor status parallel with SCLPC

identity_and_status: Both parties' passports, biometric pages, entry stamps/records
Applicant's current visitor status documents, extension records (if any)
Both parties' divorce judgments/divorce certificates (including effective date)
cohabitation_evidence: Property documents (title/property tax/mortgage/municipal tax bills) showing address belongs to sponsor
Third-party records with applicant's name and same address (government letters, bank statements, phone bills, insurance, driver's license/BCID, medical card/clinic letters)
Shared living utility bills (water, electricity, gas, property, home insurance)
shared_finances_and_interdependence: Joint account or at least 'shared payment/shared benefit' records
Beneficiary designations (insurance/pension/work benefits) and emergency contacts
social_recognition: Statutory declarations or recommendation letters with identity information from both parties' families/friends
Wedding-related materials (invitations, venue contracts, guest photos, gift money records)
child_information: Child's birth certificate/passport/household register/parent-child relationship documents
Proof materials for whether child is accompanying/non-accompanying dependent child (custody, guardianship arrangements, other parent's consent letter, etc.)
historical_consistency_check_package: Screenshots or photocopies of key fields from all previous applications (visitor/study permit/work permit/PR): marital status, cohabitation, children, address, work history
If inconsistencies exist: first internal audit reasons and evidence, then decide 'explanation + correction' presentation strategy

findings.description: '12 years old' and 'birth date 2020-01-03' cannot both be true; if inconsistencies appear in any form/statement/past application, triggers IRPA s.40 misrepresentation risk (including 'non-intentional' can also constitute)
Burnaby, BC and postal code V2X 0Y2 do not match; belongs to core identity information contradiction, if inconsistent across forms/supporting documents, also triggers IRPA s.40 risk

Cohabitation origin is landlord-tenant, short interval from dating confirmation to marriage and submission; in absence of strong shared life/financial/social recognition evidence, easily attributed to 'primary purpose for immigration' or 'relationship not genuine'

findings.issue: Cohabitation and shared life evidence strength unknown
findings.description: If only oral explanations, few photos or chat records, usually insufficient to offset 'landlord-tenant origin + quick marriage submission' structural suspicion
Without joint accounts, shared bills, insurance beneficiaries, shared responsibility division, long-term planning, etc., IRPR 4(1) defense strength is significantly insufficient

findings.issue: Previous marriage end and timeline connection need precise consistency
findings.description: Both parties' divorce document effective dates, separation/divorce narratives, and new relationship start times must be completely aligned; any overlap or vague expression will be amplified in review

findings.issue: Applicant status and Canadian residence continuity need verification
findings.description: Spouse in-Canada category emphasizes 'cohabitation in Canada'; if visitor status has expiration, entry/exit interruption of cohabitation, or cohabitation address evidence gaps, will trigger eligibility and credibility issues

findings.issue: Sponsorship capacity not hard threshold but will be factually reviewed
findings.description: Sponsor's monthly income of 3600 is feasible, but must exclude statutory ineligibility factors like social assistance (non-disability), arrears/default, bankruptcy restrictions, etc.; and provide verifiable income and employment stability evidence

required_fixes.fix: Immediately freeze pre-submission version, launch 'misrepresentation risk hemostasis': item-by-item compare all forms and supporting documents to be submitted for name spelling, birthday, marital status, relationship start/end dates, cohabitation address, child information, establish unique 'master data table', correct any inconsistencies before submission

Child information must be qualified first then finalized (highest priority): clarify whether child is applicant's accompanying/non-accompanying dependent child, or sponsor's child/stepchild, or unrelated to this case; confirm unique correct birth date, age, father/mother information, custody/support rights, whether accompanying; synchronously correct all documents and narratives appearing in '12 years old/2020 birth' versions

Address information full-chain correction (highest priority): use property documents/property tax bills/title documents as anchor to confirm true address (including city+postal code), ensure all forms, explanation letters, rental/cohabitation evidence, bill mailing addresses are consistent
Build verifiable evidence package for IRPR 4(1) (reinforce by weight): cohabitation evidence, relationship transition evidence, financial and dependency evidence, social recognition evidence

Previous marriage materials and narrative calibration: provide both parties' divorce proofs (including effective date), and clearly state in relationship narrative: each party's previous marriage end (separation/divorce) and new relationship start have no overlap

Compliance (forms/fees/category/submission) must be verified to reproducible standards: confirm Spouse or Common-Law Partner in Canada Class selected and matches 'cohabitation in Canada' fact; confirm full Sponsorship + Processing + RPRF + Biometrics paid; key form fields must match evidence

Red line check that must be coordinated with AuditManager (must be completed before finalization): previous application/visa/entry records and this case statement consistency verification (focus: marital status, child declaration, cohabitation facts, address, entry/exit times); if historical materials show different versions of child/marriage/cohabitation, must first do 'correction and explanation strategy', otherwise recommend pausing submission to avoid IRPA s.40 irreversible consequences

IRPR_4_1.description: Relationship timeline unfavorable to IRPR 4(1); in absence of strong shared life/financial/social recognition evidence, easily attributed to 'primary purpose for immigration' or 'relationship not genuine'

IRPA_s_40.description: Child information hard contradiction and address error trigger IRPA s.40 misrepresentation risk

eligibility_clauses.description: Applicant status and Canadian residence continuity need verification

admissibility_factors.description: No obvious crime, medical, security risk facts

final_decision.rationale: Multiple serious issues requiring immediate correction exist, including child information contradiction, address information error, insufficient IRPR 4(1) evidence

tasks: Calibrate previous marriage materials and narrative

must_complete_before_finalization: Previous application/visa/entry records and this case statement consistency verification
If historical materials show different versions, must first do 'correction and explanation strategy'

final_decision.recommendation: After completing all first and second priority corrections, reassess risk. If risk score drops below 50/100, consider submitting application. If risk score remains above 50/100, recommend continuing to strengthen evidence chain or considering other options
